node.title: Philadelphia water main break prompts evacuations, closures
node.description: The transmission main, which moves thousands of gallons of water, is one of the largest in the city.

node.title: Chipotle plans to hike menu prices again, citing inflation
node.description: Restaurant chain is paying more for beef, avocados and freight — and passing those costs on to consumers.

node.title: West Ham Fines Kurt Zouma Over Cat Abuse Video
node.description: Zouma, a defender who also plays for the French national soccer team, lost a sponsorship deal with Adidas on Wednesday after a video circulated online of him kicking his cat.

node.title: Several Washington, D.C., schools evacuated after bomb threats
node.description: This is the second day Dunbar High School was dealing with a threat.

node.title: In Ukraine Crisis, Putin’s Choices Are Both Varied and Stark
node.description: Russia can seize control over Ukraine or keep strong economic ties to Europe. It will be hard to do both.

node.title: Waka Kotahi intent on blanket cut to speed limits across Northland
node.description: Northland has become New Zealand's first region-wide location for potentially cutting highway speed limits to 80km/h because of its roading management challenges.

node.title: Anti-vaccine Murupara GP suspended pending further investigation
node.description: The anti-vax GP has been pushing his views on the practice's Facebook page for months, calling the vaccine "a gene therapy injection".

node.title: Politicians decry protest disruption, say restrictions will end eventually
node.description: Vaccine mandates and passes should eventually end and the government should set a timeline for that, opposition parties say, but they do not support today's protests.

node.title: OT apologises for incorrect information on $4m sexual violence programme underspend
node.description: Oranga Tamariki has apologised for providing inaccurate information to RNZ about its sexual violence programmes for children.

node.title: Russia's massive military buildup: Photos
node.description: Photos from Russia's borders show a recent amassing of weapons, vehicles and personnel.

node.title: Agencies, including police, often oppose evicting poorly behaved tenants - Kāinga Ora
node.description: The state landlord says it's been warned by other agencies that evicting disruptive tenants would make their work with them "a waste of time".

node.title: 'Unacceptable': PM criticises cleaning business' use of graphic images on social media
node.description: The prime minister has condemned a trauma cleaning company that has been posting graphic death-related images on social media.

node.title: Three anti-vaccine mandate protesters charged with obstruction
node.description: Police have charged three people with obstruction after a group of anti-vaccine mandate protesters tried to push through a fence on Parliament grounds.

node.title: 'The list goes on and on': Many ignored abuse at Marylands - advocate
node.description: An advocate for sexual abuse survivors at Marylands School says the sexual and physical abuse was known about by many, but they all failed to act on it.

node.title: Healthcare workers say they're facing verbal and physical abuse amid COVID misinformation
node.description: A hospital near Atlanta said its healthcare workers have been threatened by patients and families who want treatments that have not proven to be effective against COVID.

node.title: Masked No More?
node.description: Noses — and maybe smiles — may soon make an appearance in some classrooms, now that several states plan to end mask mandates.

node.title: Watch Live: NFL chief faces reporters amid discrimination accusations
node.description: NFL Commissioner Roger Goodell is facing reporters a week after former Miami Dolphins head coach Brian Flores accused the league, the Dolphins and two other teams of racial discrimination.

node.title: White Ferns win series opener
node.description: The White Ferns have won the only T20 of the series against India in Queenstown.

node.title: 'Unprecedented': Growers worried fruit picking will coincide with Omicron peak
node.description: New Zealand's biggest pipfruit region is bracing itself for another impossibly tough season.

node.title: UFC fighter Carlos Ulberg: 'This is my career, but also my university'
node.description: "I was always known for breaking stuff. Every home I went to. Known for breaking something, or breaking someone." - Carlos Ulberg prepares for his upcoming fight against Fabio Cherant on UFC 271.

node.title: New York's mask mandate for businesses will be lifted Thursday
node.description: "New Yorkers did the right thing to get through the winter surge," said Governor Kathy Hochul.

node.title: Black Caps T20 series against Australia abandoned
node.description: New Zealand Cricket has called off the Australian men's brief T20 tour here next month.

node.title: New evidence casts doubt on Black man's attempted rape conviction
node.description: A judge is expected to rule next week on whether Vincent Simmons is entitled to a new trial after evidence was allegedly withheld during his trial decades ago.

node.title: Parents of American killed in Greece speak to CBS News ahead of retrial
node.description: Bakari Henderson was 22 years old and on a business trip in Zakynthos, Greece in 2017 when he was chased down by an angry mob and beaten to death following an altercation in a bar.

node.title: Industrial wasteland becomes Winter Olympic showpiece
node.description: A key selling point at the Beijing Winter Olympics is the organiser's claim to be the "green" Games.

node.title: US accuses couple of laundering $4.5bn in Bitcoin tied to currency exchange hack
node.description: The US Justice Department said it had unraveled its biggest-ever cryptocurrency theft, seizing a record-shattering $US3.6 billion in Bitcoin tied to hack of digital currency exchange Bitfinex.

node.title: Postal Service reform bill heads to Senate after bipartisan House vote
node.description: "It is my intention for the Senate to quickly take up and pass this bipartisan, bicameral postal reform bill," Majority Leader Chuck Schumer said.

node.title: How to claim child credit money on your taxes this year
node.description: Although the enhanced payments ended in December, families who didn't get their money last year can still claim it.

node.title: U.S. replaces Trump mission statement that cut "nation of immigrants" label
node.description: The Biden administration's new mission statement calls the U.S. "a nation of welcome and possibility."

node.title: Malala Yousafzai joins outcry over "horrifying" hijab bans in India
node.description: A state-run college in Karnataka state barred a group of Muslim students from class, sparking a wave of protests and rekindling India's deep-rooted religious tension.
